com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler

Class SchedulerConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.SchedulerConfig

  • public final class SchedulerConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates global Scheduler settings retrieved from the environment. Presented as a non-static object to simplify scheduler tests, and to make it painfully obvious when global settings are being used in awkward places.

    • Field Detail

      • RESERVE_DISCIPLINE_ENV

        public static final java.lang.String RESERVE_DISCIPLINE_ENV
        (Multi-service only) Envvar to specify the number of services that may be reserving footprint at the same time.
        • High value (or <=0 for no limit): Faster deployment across multiple services, but risks deadlocks if two simultaneous deployments both want the same resources. However, this can be ameliorated by enforcing per-service quotas.
        • Lower value: Slower deployment, but reduces the risk of two deploying services being stuck on the same resource. Setting the value to 1 should remove the risk entirely.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MESOS_API_VERSION_V1

        public static final java.lang.String MESOS_API_VERSION_V1
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getExecutorResources

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Protos.Value> getExecutorResources()
        Returns the default resources to be require for a pod's executor, in addition to any resources for the tasks composing the pod. This is effectively the configured executor overhead.
        Returns:
        a mapping of resource name to value for the resources to be reserved for a pod's executor

      • getApiServerPort

        public int getApiServerPort()

      • isSideChannelActive

        public boolean isSideChannelActive()
        Returns whether it appears that side channel auth should be used when creating the SchedulerDriver. Side channel auth may take the form of Bouncer-based framework authentication or potentially other methods in the future (e.g. Kerberos).

      • getDcosAuthTokenProvider

        public TokenProvider getDcosAuthTokenProvider()
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a token provider which may be used to retrieve DC/OS JWT auth tokens, or throws an exception if the local environment doesn't provide the needed information (e.g. on a DC/OS Open cluster)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getAutoipTLD

        public java.lang.String getAutoipTLD()
        Returns the TLD to be used in advertised autoip endpoints. This may be overridden in cases where autoip support isn't available, or if some other TLD should be used instead.

        Resolves to the IP of the host iff the container if on the host network and the IP of the container iff the container is on the overlay network. If the container is on multiple virtual networks or experimenting with different DNS providers this TLD may have unexpected behavior.

      • getVipTLD

        public java.lang.String getVipTLD()
        Returns the TLD to be used in advertised VIP endpoints. This may be overridden in cases where VIPs aren't available, or if some other TLD should be used instead.

      • getMarathonName

        public java.lang.String getMarathonName()
        Returns the name of the Marathon instance managing the service. This may be overridden in cases where a non-default Marathon instance (e.g. MoM) is running the scheduler.

        This is used for constructing an endpoint for reaching the Scheduler from tasks, specifically for config template distribution.

      • getImplicitReconcileDelayMs

        public long getImplicitReconcileDelayMs()
        Returns the duration to wait after framework registration before performing the first implicit reconciliation, in milliseconds.

      • getImplicitReconcilePeriodMs

        public long getImplicitReconcilePeriodMs()
        Returns the duration to wait between implicit reconciliations, in milliseconds.

      • isRegionAwarenessEnabled

        public boolean isRegionAwarenessEnabled()
        Returns whether region awareness should be enabled. In 1.11, this is an explicit opt-in by users.

      • getSchedulerIP

        public java.lang.String getSchedulerIP()
        Returns the IP of the scheduler task's container. Note, this is dependent on the fact we are using the command executor.

      • getBuildInfo

        public JSONObject getBuildInfo()
